reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved hotel canada. the service was great. the rooms were very nice. and the breakfast was delicious. Its a few blocks from termini and there is a subway stop right around the corner. there are several places to rent scooters around the hotel as well as many restaurants and cafes. I did not take pictures because the pictures online are acurate.
reviews.title: I would stay here again

reviews.text: One tip is DO NOT exchange money at any of those little exchange places around rome. you are better off using your credit card. The cards get a much better rate and even if there is a fee is not as high as the fees charged by the exchange booths. they charge us 17% and when I told her I didn't want to exchange she refused to give me my dollars back... well that has nothing to do with Hotel Canada but just a warning.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: We (three young middle aged couples) stayed at hotel Canada for 5 days recently and had a great stay. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean compared to other european capital city hotels. The bar drinks are cheap and free nibbles were a nice touch before seeing Rome by night. The breakfast provided was more than enough to keep you going through the morning sightseeing. Everyone of the staff were very helpful and friendley and we would certainly return to this hotel. The hotel is close to the main rail station and the metro is just around the corner. The area is abit run down but we never felt any unease walking about. Be careful of pickpockets on the metro we had a camera stolen from right under our noses.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY! CLEAN and PERFECT LOCATION!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel two separate nights, a week apart. Each stay was great. The rooms were clean. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful. The staff was friendly. The hotel is just a few blocks from Termini Station also the subway line around the corner, which made it a great central location to travel around Rome from. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: pleasant choice

likes.disliked: — location was out of central downtown area

reviews.text: My husband, teen daughter, and I stayed at the Hotel Canada based on other message board recommendations. This hotel lived up to my expectations from the other reviewers and I was not disappointed. The rooms, reception area, and breakfast area were comfortable, clean, nice. The location is not right centrally located but we were able to taxis to any city location. We dined at a great restaurant 1/2 block away on our last night. I would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: This Hotel is a Jewel!

likes.disliked: — There's nothing not to like here. Seriously!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel in something of a hurry, having left it a little late to book for our holiday. We booked it through air-miles (would be decent value for money generally anyway), and were pleased with the reviews on this web-site. However, there was a hint of nerves as we have had variable experiences of Best Western hotels in the UK.
reviews.title: Perfect companion to a great city!!!

reviews.text: It turned out to be a perfect choice for us, and it was great to have such a lovely base for several days of tiring, but massively fulfilling, walking around this amazing city.
reviews.title: Great Rome Hotel - Close to Termini

likes.disliked: — in a noisy area - but that is Rome in general

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only speak in very positive terms about this hotel. The hotel, generally, felt very classy, very well furnished, and full of lovely little touches (e.g. antique looking desk in room, shoe polishing kit in wardrobe). The room was a good size and very well presented.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: We had read another review of issues with the lift in the hotel being too small etc. With respect, I think the reviewer missed the point somewhat as the lift is a wonderful addition to the hotel, and has a charm of its own. Staff at the hotel were very polite and very helpful, any requests were dealt with quickly even if busy.
reviews.title: Awesome!

likes.liked: — Great location to hop the train or metro line.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good, a good selection of options to fill you up for your day of walking, including hot food which is always welcome. Get there early though, as it become very busy after 7.30-45am and its not the biggest breakfast room.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel for three nights. First in room 308 and then in room 208.
reviews.title: Great choice near the subway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms were great. The 208 was more modern and had been renovated recently. The room was spacious and the bathroom lovely. Very large closet and there was a safe in the room.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room 308 was for three people and very traditional in design with alot of wood accents. The room was lovely and the bathroom very nice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, couldn't be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean with modern facilities. We have stayed in about 6 hotels in Rome (from four star to six star) in the last 10 years and this one was among the best. You can't beat the price of the hotel. The breakfast was lovely and the there were some choices for vegetarians.
reviews.title: Spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a lovely selection of snacks at the bar every day at 5:00pm and the bar area is quite nice for drinks also.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Great Location

likes.liked: — The entire package and excellent value for money partcularly in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend break 19th September 2008 based on tripadvisor reviews. Can only agree with the majority opinion. Very well run hotel,friendly and helpful staff. Not in a great part of town but with the Metro Castro Pretorio just around the corner and Termini an easy ten minute walk away makes for an excellent base for exploring Rome. Prices for drinks in the hotel bar were very reasonable and the bar is a very pleasant place to relax. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a very large selection. Our room whilst not that large was very clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked well. The hotel provides free wifi access which was fast and never dropped. The double glazing was extremely effective in keeping out the street noise. Will definitely return here again.
reviews.title: Lovely family run hotel

likes.liked: — Friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Canada in Rome for three nights. We were three adults and one child. This hotel was excellent. It is well maintained and beautifully decorated. The price is very reasonable considering the experience. We had a suite with queen size bed and a covertible sofa. The room had AC, flat screen TV, and a bathroom with granite countertops. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was great. We were able to park directly in front of the hotel entrance for the entire time, we just had to put 11 euros in the meter each day (there is no hotel parking). The bartender, reception and breakfast room staff was all so nice. Prices for drinks at the bar are cheap by Rome standards. The hotel is one block from the blue train line which takes you directly to the colosseum or the main train station for transfers to the red line and the other tourist sites. The neighborhood is nice. The local restaurants are not so great, I would recommend going into the city for the restaurants. I would definitely stay here again, it was a big part of our great holiday in Rome
reviews.title: Great Rome Experience

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of July. Just a few blocks from the termini and about a block away from the local metro, this hotel is located in a convenient area of Rome. The staff was very friendly and helped us pick out the main sites to view in our short time there and forms of transportation. The room was big and cozy. There were 3 of us so we got a queen bed and one single. The bathroom had all the amenities and was also really big. They had the lift you see in the movies where u have to close the double doors before the lift goes up, very cute. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, which is free for all guests. Probably one of the best buffet breakfasts i've been too with a great selection of food. All in all, our stay at the Best Western Hotel Canada was amazing. From the friendly staff to the location, everything was great. Rome is a place i would like to visit again and again, and when we come back, we would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Convenient location & very friendly staff

reviews.text: We stayed here this summer during the first leg of our holiday as we wanted a good secure and safe base for a family so we could see all the major sites in Rome with ease but without a very high cost.
reviews.title: Very Convenient and Nice Welcome

likes.liked: — Pleasant welcome and helfulness of staff. Very pleasant room

reviews.text: The hotel is about 500m from Termini and as we arrived in Ciampino we took the express bus direct to the station and made the short walk to the Hotel. There is a metro station just behind the hotel so its easy to get around and there are also some convenience shops nearby in caee you need anything.
reviews.title: Perfect for sightseeing in Rome

likes.liked: — Quiet location, but close to train station
